title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pylaschooldata && pytest tests/test_pylaschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pylaschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: laschooldata R package downloading processing K-12 public school enrollment data Louisiana Department Education (LDOE). package provides clean, tidy data suitable analysis.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Primary Source: Louisiana Department Education Multi Stats Files - URL Pattern: https://www.louisianabelieves.com/docs/default-source/data-management/oct-{YEAR}-multi-stats-(total--site--school-system).xlsx - Snapshot Date: October 1st school year - Data Center: https://doe.louisiana.gov/data--reports/enrollment-data

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Confirmed Working: 2019-2024 (6 years) - Earlier years (2007-2018) may exist use different URL patterns file structures

what: Demographic Groups (stored as COUNTS in raw data)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: White Black Hispanic Asian Hawaiian/Pacific Islander American Indian/Native American Multiple Races (Non-Hispanic) Minority (aggregate)

what: Gender (stored as PERCENTAGES in raw data - converted to counts)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Male (% Male -> count via total * pct/100) Female (% Female -> count via total * pct/100)

what: Special Populations (stored as PERCENTAGES in raw data - converted to counts)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Limited English Proficiency (LEP) Fully English Proficient (FEP) Economically Disadvantaged

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Infants (Sp Ed) Pre-School (Sp Ed) Pre-K (Reg Ed) Kindergarten Grades 1-12 Grade T9 (transitional 9th grade) Extension Academy

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: tidy=TRUE version MUST maintain fidelity raw, unprocessed source file. processing data: 1. Race/ethnicity counts must exactly match raw file 2. Gender counts calculated percentages: count = round(total * pct / 100) 3. Special population counts calculated percentages similarly 4. Grade-level counts must exactly match raw file

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: raw LDOE data stores gender “% Male” “% Female”, counts. package converts counts using total enrollment. IMPORTANT: Percentage format varies year! - 2024+: Stored “48.8%” (% sign, already percentage form) - 2019-2023: Stored 0.48846847… (decimal format, needs *100) safe_percentage() function automatically detects normalizes formats: 1. Checks values “%” sign 2. % sign found values <=1, multiplies 100 3. Returns percentages 0-100 range years CRITICAL BUG caused “0 male” values 2019-2023 decimals incorrectly used percentages.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Post-Hurricane Katrina, Orleans Parish public schools reorganized. now Recovery School District charter operators. District code “036” main Orleans Parish school system.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: LEA sheet includes state-wide total row district_id = “000” name “State Louisiana”.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Multi Stats Excel files complex header structure: - Row 1: Title - Row 2: FERPA disclaimer - Row 3: Category headers (e.g., “Students Gender”) - Row 4: Column sub-headers (e.g., “% Female”, “% Male”) - Row 5: Blank - Row 6+: Data

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE) - Fetch single year fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE) - Fetch multiple years get_available_years() - Get available year range

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: tidy_enr(df) - Transform wide data tidy/long format id_enr_aggs(df) - Add is_state, is_district, is_campus flags enr_grade_aggs(df) - Add grade band aggregations (ELEM, MIDDLE, HIGH)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: cache_status() - View cached data status clear_cache() - Clear cached data

title: Claude Code Instructions
code: library(laschooldata)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # State-level totals state <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Get multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024)  # Track enrollment trends trends <- enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Tests verify: 1. available years (2019-2024) work correctly 2. Male/female enrollment ZERO (critical bug fix) 3. Race/ethnicity counts match raw file values 4. Gender percentages calculated counts correct 5. Grade-level data properly parsed 6. Aggregation flags work correctly 7. Multi-year fetching works 8. Cache functions work

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: 2019-2024 confirmed working (earlier years may different formats) Gender special population counts derived percentages (may rounding differences) Orleans Parish data fragmented across multiple entities post-Katrina Extension Academy enrollment may available years/districts

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use man/figures/ generate_readme_figs.R README images. README images MUST come pkgdown-generated vignette output auto-update merge: : Vignette figures regenerate automatically pkgdown builds. Manual man/figures/ requires running separate script easy forget, causing stale/broken images.

what: 1. Hurricane Katrina’s lasting mark on New Orleans
title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Orleans Parish lost 60% students 2005 never fully recovered. Recovery School District reshaped public education.
code: orleans <- enr_long %>%   filter(is_district, district_name == "Orleans Parish",          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(orleans, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Orleans Parish Post-Katrina",        subtitle = "Never fully recovered from 2005 hurricane",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: New Orleans became America’s first -charter city. “Type 2 Charters” district tracks statewide charter enrollment.
code: # Louisiana tracks charter schools under the "Type 2 Charters" LEA charter <- enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl("Type 2 Charter", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(charter, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Louisiana Charter School Enrollment (Type 2)",        subtitle = "New Orleans became America's first all-charter city",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: East Baton Rouge Parish now enrolls students Orleans, becoming Louisiana’s largest district.
code: br_orleans <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name %in% c("East Baton Rouge Parish", "Orleans Parish"),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(br_orleans, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Baton Rouge Surpasses New Orleans",        subtitle = "East Baton Rouge is now Louisiana's largest district",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: African American Hispanic students together now comprise 55% enrollment.
code: # Get total enrollment to calculate percentages state_totals <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, total = n_students)  demo <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   left_join(state_totals, by = "end_year") %>%   mutate(pct = n_students / total * 100)  ggplot(demo, aes(x = end_year, y = pct, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_color_manual(values = colors,                      labels = c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic", "White")) +   labs(title = "Louisiana Demographics",        subtitle = "African American and Hispanic students are majority",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent of Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Louisiana lost 8% kindergartners pandemic, enrollment hasn’t fully rebounded.
code: k_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "09", "12")) %>%   mutate(grade_label = case_when(     grade_level == "K" ~ "Kindergarten",     grade_level == "01" ~ "Grade 1",     grade_level == "09" ~ "Grade 9",     grade_level == "12" ~ "Grade 12"   ))  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_label)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2021, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "COVID Impact on Louisiana Enrollment",        subtitle = "Kindergarten hit hardest in 2020-21",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

what: 6. Rural parishes are losing students fastest
title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Parishes like Tensas, East Carroll, Madison lost 30% enrollment decade.
code: rural <- c("Tensas Parish", "East Carroll Parish", "Madison Parish") rural_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl(paste(rural, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(rural_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Delta Parishes Combined",        subtitle = "Tensas, East Carroll, and Madison losing students",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Louisiana’s second-largest parish maintained steady enrollment urban cores fluctuate.
code: jefferson <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, district_name == "Jefferson Parish",          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(jefferson, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Jefferson Parish - Suburban Stability",        subtitle = "Louisiana's second-largest maintains steady enrollment",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: EL students grown 3% 5% enrollment, concentrated certain parishes.
code: el <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "lep", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   left_join(state_totals, by = "end_year") %>%   mutate(pct = n_students / total * 100)  ggplot(el, aes(x = end_year, y = pct)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   labs(title = "English Learners on the Rise",        subtitle = "From 3% to over 5% of enrollment",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent of Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 9. Economic disadvantage concentrated in the Delta
title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Delta parishes like Madison, Tensas, East Carroll 90% economically disadvantaged students.
code: # Get district totals for current year to calculate percentages district_totals <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(district_name, total = n_students)  econ <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "econ_disadv", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   left_join(district_totals, by = "district_name") %>%   mutate(pct = n_students / total * 100) %>%   arrange(desc(pct)) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, pct))  ggplot(econ, aes(x = district_label, y = pct)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Highest Poverty Parishes",        subtitle = "Delta parishes exceed 90% economically disadvantaged",        x = "", y = "Percent Economically Disadvantaged") +   theme_readme()

title: Louisiana Enrollment Trends
text: Parishes along interstate corridor (Livingston, Ascension, St. Tammany) Louisiana’s growth engines.
code: i10 <- c("Livingston Parish", "Ascension Parish", "St. Tammany Parish") i10_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl(paste(i10, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(i10_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "I-10/I-12 Corridor Growth",        subtitle = "Livingston, Ascension, and St. Tammany lead Louisiana",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: laschooldata package provides easy access Louisiana K-12 public school enrollment data Louisiana Department Education (LDOE). data comes Multi Stats reports published October.

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: library(laschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Check available years get_available_years() # Returns: min_year = 2019, max_year = 2024

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: Use fetch_enr() download enrollment data single school year: tidy format includes: - end_year: School year end (e.g., 2024 = 2023-24) - type: “State”, “District”, “Campus” - district_id: 3-digit parish code - campus_id: Site code (NA state/district rows) - district_name: Parish name - campus_name: School name - subgroup: Demographic group (e.g., “total_enrollment”, “white”, “male”) - grade_level: Grade level (e.g., “TOTAL”, “K”, “01”) - n_students: Student count - is_state, is_district, is_campus: Aggregation level flags
code: # Get 2024 data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # By default, returns tidy (long) format head(enr_2024)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: wide format (one row per entity), use tidy = FALSE:
code: enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Wide format has columns for each subgroup names(enr_wide) # Includes: row_total, white, black, hispanic, asian, male, female, etc.

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: Use fetch_enr_multi() multiple years:
code: enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track state enrollment trends enr_multi |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: enr_2024 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(subgroup, n_students) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(10)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: enr_2024 |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level != "TOTAL") |>   select(grade_level, n_students) |>   arrange(grade_level)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: # Get racial demographics for top 5 districts top_districts <- enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(5) |>   pull(district_id)  enr_2024 |>   filter(is_district, district_id %in% top_districts, grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(     id_cols = district_name,     names_from = subgroup,     values_from = n_students   )

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
code: enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024)  state_trends <- enr_multi |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   arrange(end_year) |>   mutate(     change = n_students - lag(n_students),     pct_change = change / lag(n_students) * 100   )  state_trends

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: package caches downloaded data locally speed repeated access:
code: # View cache status cache_status()  # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear specific year clear_cache(2024)  # Force fresh download (bypass cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: Louisiana uses 3-digit parish codes district IDs: - 001 = Acadia Parish - 017 = East Baton Rouge Parish - 026 = Jefferson Parish - 000 = State total (included LEA data)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: State: Statewide totals District: Parish/LEA-level data Campus: Individual school data

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: Demographics (counts): - total_enrollment, white, black, hispanic, asian - pacific_islander, native_american, multiracial, minority Gender (calculated percentages): - male, female Special Populations (calculated percentages): - lep (Limited English Proficiency) - fep (Fully English Proficient) - econ_disadv (Economically Disadvantaged)

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: INF: Infants (Special Ed) PS: Pre-School (Special Ed) PK: Pre-K (Regular Ed) K: Kindergarten 01-12: Grades 1-12 T9: Transitional 9th grade EXT: Extension Academy

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: Gender, LEP, Economic Disadvantage data stored percentages LDOE source files, counts. package converts counts using: Important: source data format varies year: - 2024+: Percentages stored “48.8%” (% sign) - 2019-2023: Percentages stored decimals like 0.488 package automatically detects normalizes formats ensure consistent output across years.

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: verify gender data processed correctly:
code: enr <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE) state <- enr[enr$type == "State", ]  # These should be approximately equal state$row_total state$male + state$female  # Percentages should be in 0-100 range state$pct_male  # ~51% state$pct_female  # ~49%

title: Getting Started with laschooldata
text: “end_year must 2019 2024” package currently supports 2019-2024. Earlier years use different file formats. Missing data districts smaller districts charter schools may suppressed data privacy. Male/female values seem Gender data stored percentages source file. package converts counts using: count = round(total * pct / 100). Ensure pct_male pct_female 40-60% range (0.40-0.60).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). laschooldata: Louisiana School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/laschooldata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {laschooldata: Louisiana School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/laschooldata/}, }

title: Louisiana School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started | Enrollment Trends Fetch analyze Louisiana school enrollment data Louisiana Department Education (LDOE) R Python.

what: What can you find with laschooldata?
title: Louisiana School Data
text: 19 years enrollment data (2007-2025). 700,000+ students today. 69 parishes. ten stories hiding numbers (see Enrollment Trends vignette interactive visualizations): Hurricane Katrina’s lasting mark New Orleans - Orleans Parish lost 60% students 2005 never fully recovered Louisiana’s charter school revolution - New Orleans became America’s first -charter city Baton Rouge boom - East Baton Rouge Parish now enrolls students Orleans Louisiana’s majority-minority milestone - African American Hispanic students together comprise 55% enrollment COVID hit kindergarten hardest - Louisiana lost 8% kindergartners pandemic Rural parishes losing students fastest - Tensas, East Carroll, Madison lost 30% enrollment Jefferson Parish: suburban stability - Louisiana’s second-largest maintains steady enrollment English learners rise - EL students grown 3% 5% enrollment Economic disadvantage concentrated Delta - Delta parishes exceed 90% economically disadvantaged -10/-12 corridor drives growth - Livingston, Ascension, St. Tammany lead Louisiana

title: Louisiana School Data
code: library(laschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch recent years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # Parish (district) breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics statewide enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Louisiana School Data
code: import pylaschooldata as la  # Fetch 2025 data (2024-25 school year) enr = la.fetch_enr(2025)  # Statewide total total = enr[(enr['is_state']) & (enr['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &             (enr['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment')]['n_students'].sum() print(f"{total:,} students") #> ~680,000 students  # Get multiple years enr_multi = la.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # Check available years years = la.get_available_years() print(f"Data available: {years['min_year']}-{years['max_year']}") #> Data available: 2007-2025

title: Louisiana School Data
text: Data sourced Louisiana Department Education Multi Stats files: - https://www.louisianabelieves.com/resources/library/student-attributes - https://doe.louisiana.gov/data--reports/enrollment-data

title: Louisiana School Data
text: Levels: State, Parish (69 districts), Site (school) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: Economically disadvantaged, LEP/English learners, Special education Grade levels: PK 12

title: Louisiana School Data
text: Louisiana uses parishes instead counties Orleans Parish includes Orleans Parish School Board Recovery School District schools Enrollment based October 1 (MFP) counts Charter schools included authorizing parish

text: Removes cached data files.

title: Clear cached data — clear_cache
text: end_year Optional specific year clear. NULL, clears . cache_type Optional cache type clear ("tidy", "wide"). NULL, clears .

title: Clear cached data — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear specific year clear_cache(2024)  # Clear only wide format cache clear_cache(cache_type = "wide") } # }

title: Create state-level aggregate from LEA data — create_state_aggregate

what: Download file with retry logic — download_with_retry

title: Fetch Louisiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Louisiana Department Education Multi Stats files.

title: Fetch Louisiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - e.g., 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2007-2025 (Multi Stats format). Data 2006 also available uses different format. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download LDOE.

title: Fetch Louisiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Louisiana enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific parish orleans <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(district_id == "036") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Louisiana Department Education (LDOE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Multi Stats reports transforming tidy format analysis.

title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: Louisiana uses parish-based ID system: District IDs (LEA): 3 digits representing parishes (e.g., 001 = Acadia) Site Codes: School-level identifiers within LEA

title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Louisiana Department Education: Multi Stats: https://www.louisianabelieves.com/resources/library/student-attributes Data Center: https://doe.louisiana.gov/data--reports/enrollment-data

title: laschooldata: Fetch and Process Louisiana School Data — laschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

what: Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
title: Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
text: Pivots wide enrollment data long format subgroup grade_level columns. makes data easier analyze filter.

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
text: df Data frame wide format process_enr

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
text: Data frame tidy format columns: end_year School year end type Row type: State, District, Campus district_id 3-digit parish code campus_id Site code (NA district/state rows) district_name Parish name campus_name Site name (NA district/state rows) subgroup Subgroup name (e.g., "total_enrollment", "male", "white") grade_level Grade level (e.g., "TOTAL", "K", "01", "02") n_students Student count subgroup/grade

title: Transform enrollment data to tidy (long) format — tidy_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ wide_data <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE) tidy_data <- tidy_enr(wide_data) } # }
